combTMB 0.0.0.9000

    Optimization control options

    combTMBcontrol.Rd

    Optimization control options

    Usage

    combTMBcontrol(
  optimizer = c("nlminb", "optim"),
  optim.method = "BFGS",
  eval.max = 2000L,
  iter.max = 2000L,
  maxit = 500L,
  nlminbLoops = 1L,
  newtonLoops = 0L,
  zerodisp_val = log(sqrt(.Machine$double.eps)),
  start_params = NULL,
  lower = NULL,
  upper = NULL,
  gjp = TRUE,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    optimizer

    optimization with "nlminb" or "optim".

    optim.method

    by default, the optimizer performs minimization with the `BFGS` method. If the lower and upper limits are declared the indicated method is the `L-BFGS-B`.

    eval.max

    maximum number of evaluations of the objective function allowed.

    iter.max

    maximum number of iterations allowed.

    maxit

    the maximum number of iterations for the "optim" method.

    nlminbLoops

    how many times to run "nlminb" optimization. Sometimes restarting the optimizer at the previous best values aids convergence. If the maximum gradient is still too large, try increasing this to `2`.

    newtonLoops

    how many Newton optimization steps to try with "optimHess" after running "nlminb". Sometimes aids convergence.

    zerodisp_val

    value of the dispersion parameter when dformula=~0 is specified.

    start_params

    the user can specify initial values for the parameters.

    lower

    an optional named list of lower bounds within the optimization.

    upper

    an optional named list of upper bounds within the optimization.

    gjp

    logical. Passed to `getJointPrecision` in "sdreport". Must be `TRUE` to use simulation-based methods. If not needed, setting this `FALSE` will reduce object size.

    ...

    currently not used.

    Author

    Deoclecio Jardim Amorim <deocleciojardimamorim@gmail.com>.
